greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Characteristic function for A256450: 1 if there is at least one 1-digit present in the factorial representation of n (A007623), otherwise 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10080
formula: a(0) = 0; for n >= 1, if A099563(n) = 1, then a(n) = 1, otherwise a(n) = a(A257687(n)).
a(2n+1) = 1 for all n. [Because all odd numbers end with digit 1 in factorial base.]
program: (define (A257680 n) (let loop ((n n) (i 2)) (cond ((zero? n) 0) ((= 1 (modulo n i)) 1) (else (loop (floor->exact (/ n i)) (+ 1 i))))))
;; As a recurrence utilizing memoizing definec-macro:
def a007623(n, p=2): return n if n
def a(n): return 1 if '1' in str(a007623(n)) else 0
print([a(n) for n in range(101)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 21 2017
xref: Cf. A255411 (gives the positions of zeros), A257682 (partial sums).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 04 2015
